name: places/ChIJT1W6_o9ZwokRp0oBe9Lw3IE
formattedAddress: 666 Broadway 12th Floor, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 666 Broadway 12th Floor, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text: We had a terrible experience with their work! Their approach seemed pushy and lacked professionalism. It's gotten to the point where it feels like we’re being forced, and honestly, it feels a bit like discrimination—or perhaps it's just their bossy way of doing their job. They issued directives to unit owners for tasks that weren't required, creating a sense of obligation rather than choice. Additionally, their lack of familiarity with New York deeds was evident. Despite us sending them the official deed multiple times, they failed to recognize it, requiring our lawyer to step in and sort it out. And disappointingly, no apology followed. Also, we’ve also been trying to get our email address updated for our unit, and despite several emails and calls, the change has yet to be implemented, even after half a year. They’re still struggling with this basic task!

originalText.text: First class morons who have no idea what they are doing. Andrews is what happens when you take the world's most incompetent people and put them together in one company.

text.text: First class morons who have no idea what they are doing. Andrews is what happens when you take the world's most incompetent people and put them together in one company.

originalText.text: I have been absolutely ignored for over 1 year with No fire escape, No stove, Broken windows, No Heat, Orange water, Broken Toilet with raw sewage & I reach out on a daily basis. Still ignored.

text.text: I have been absolutely ignored for over 1 year with No fire escape, No stove, Broken windows, No Heat, Orange water, Broken Toilet with raw sewage & I reach out on a daily basis. Still ignored.

originalText.text:
Andrews has managed our building for the last 5-6 years and have been on the ball when it comes to returning emails and phone calls and getting jobs done around the building.

This past Christmas Day afternoon, one of our boilers started to leak in the basement. We called Andrew’s emergency line and they had the plumber out within a few hours.  They were incredibly kind and efficient.

This past Christmas Day afternoon, one of our boilers started to leak in the basement. We called Andrew’s emergency line and they had the plumber out within a few hours.  They were incredibly kind and efficient.

originalText.text: Generally disappointed by TAO and their lack of professionalism. They do not respond to emails for weeks at a time to address any of your issues (billing, applications, closing, maintenance, or anything time sensitive) and will only send/respond to emails if it is asking you to pay for something. My building was managed by a different company prior to TAO and I've never had to send multiple follow up emails to get something resolved. I will not live in a building managed by this company moving forward.
